repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: I'm not sure why this type wasn't public in the first place. If intended I can undo the change.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -682,8 +682,7 @@ inspect_tree({opts})                           *vim.treesitter.inspect_tree()*
     Can also be shown with `:InspectTree`.                      *:InspectTree*
 
     Parameters: ~
-      • {opts}  (table|nil) Optional options table with the following possible
-                keys:
+      • {opts}  InspectTreeOpts ? Optional options table with the following possible keys:

comment_data.body: Make sure to namespace any classes you add.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,9 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
   end
 end
 
+---@class KeymapDelOpts

@@ -82,7 +82,7 @@ function M.uri_from_bufnr(bufnr)
   local fname = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_name(bufnr)
   local volume_path = fname:match('^([a-zA-Z]:).*')
   local is_windows = volume_path ~= nil
-  local scheme
+  local scheme ---@type string

comment_data.body: I had actually done that [initially](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/compare/b7453bf08af2634a43ce972c353ea61e97f80ef5..49cb777a91978a78656d5afaa7315bc84b163653), but the `doxygen` script is messed up and adds extra spaces that make CI fail :/
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,9 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
   end
 end
 
+---@class KeymapDelOpts

comment_data.body: Then we need to fix that or hold off on adding types that are exposed in the docs.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,9 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
   end
 end
 
+---@class KeymapDelOpts

comment_data.body: Undoing the change since `doxygen` is broken and I cannot it namespace it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -682,8 +682,7 @@ inspect_tree({opts})                           *vim.treesitter.inspect_tree()*
     Can also be shown with `:InspectTree`.                      *:InspectTree*
 
     Parameters: ~
-      • {opts}  (table|nil) Optional options table with the following possible
-                keys:
+      • {opts}  InspectTreeOpts ? Optional options table with the following possible keys:

comment_data.body: `@cast` usually goes on its own line. You might want to use `@as` here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,8 +44,8 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
     opts = { opts, 't', true },
   })
 
-  opts = vim.deepcopy(opts) or {}
-  mode = type(mode) == 'string' and { mode } or mode
+  opts = vim.deepcopy(opts or {})
+  mode = type(mode) == 'string' and { mode } or mode ---@cast mode string[]

@@ -67,9 +67,9 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
 
   if opts.buffer then
     local bufnr = opts.buffer == true and 0 or opts.buffer
-    opts.buffer = nil
+    opts.buffer = nil ---@type integer?
     for _, m in ipairs(mode) do
-      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(bufnr, m, lhs, rhs, opts)
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(bufnr --[[@as integer]], m, lhs, rhs, opts)

comment_data.body: Btw one trick I've used to exclude types from the docs is to use `--- @cast opts Myopts` at the top of the function body.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,9 @@ function keymap.set(mode, lhs, rhs, opts)
   end
 end
 
+---@class KeymapDelOpts

comment_data.body: This shouldn't be needed. `lang` must be losing its type further up.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -127,7 +127,7 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       )
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
-    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
+    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang --[[@as string]], opts)

comment_data.body: It's not that it's losing it's type, but the parameter type is `string|nil` but the checks above should ensure that in here we have a valid `lang`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -127,7 +127,7 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       )
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
-    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
+    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang --[[@as string]], opts)

comment_data.body: If you need to remove `nil` from a type then best to use `assert(var)`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -127,7 +127,7 @@ function M.get_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
       )
     end
   elseif parsers[bufnr] == nil or parsers[bufnr]:lang() ~= lang then
-    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang, opts)
+    parsers[bufnr] = M._create_parser(bufnr, lang --[[@as string]], opts)

comment_data.body: Why is this only changed for `vim.keymap.del()` but not `vim.keymap.set()`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -89,7 +94,7 @@ end
 --- ```
 ---
 ---@param opts table|nil A table of optional arguments:
----                      - "buffer": (number|boolean) Remove a mapping from the given buffer.
+---                      - "buffer": (integer|boolean) Remove a mapping from the given buffer.

comment_data.body: No reason in particular. I was just fixing warnings and there were none for this method, but I'll make the change as well.

   return contents
 end
